Package controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.Controller
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReportsController, TablePaneController, WindowController
    public abstract class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The base class for all controllers. It makes the application context, the database the user, the scene, and the internationalization strings conveniently available to all controllers. It segments the process of establishing a controller into construction, loading the scene and its initialization, and establishing that the application context data is available for use. It also manages multiple nested controllers and provides a convenience method for displaying database errors.
    Author:
    Joseph T. Lapp

      Convenience reference to the object representing the database
      private java.lang.String fxmlResourceFile
      FXML resource filename stored away until it can be loaded
      protected java.util.ResourceBundle i18n
      Localization keys for use by controller
      private static java.lang.String I18N_FOLDER  
      protected javafx.scene.Scene scene
      The controller's top-level scene
      protected User user
      Convenience reference to the logged-in user
      private static java.lang.String VIEW_FOLDER

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller​(java.lang.String fxmlResourceFile,
                  java.lang.String i18nPrefix)
        Constructs a generic controller.
        Parameters:
        fxmlResourceFile - Filename of the FXML resource file
        i18nPrefix - Prefix for the internationalization resource file

    • Method Detail

      • getSceneRoot

        public javafx.scene.Node getSceneRoot()
        Returns the scene's root node for the purpose of allowing the scenes of nested controllers to be embedded within those of a parent controller.
        Returns:
        The scene's root node

      • load

        public void load()
        Loads the scene, and in window controllers, opens the window. Only called in the nested-most controller constructor, after the object has been entirely configured, to ensure a valid state for initialization. Induces a call to initialize().

      • setContext

        public void setContext​(AppContext context)
        Assigns an application context to the controller, giving the controller access to application-wide data. The controller can assume that all application data is valid and usable at the time this method is called, which is why the context is not passed in via the constructor.

        LAMBDA - This lambda yields slightly less code than its equivalent 'for' loop implementation would for iterating over controllers. The lambda is only one line, while the for loop would have been two lines.

        Parameters:
        context - Global application context

      • addController

        protected void addController​(Controller controller)
        Adds a nested controller whose lifetime is tied to that of the present controller.
        Parameters:
        controller - Nested controller to add

      • onWindowClose

        protected void onWindowClose()
        Receives notice that the window is closing. It informs the nested controllers so that they may close resources.

      • reportDbError

        protected void reportDbError​(DatabaseException e)
        Utility for generically reporting unexpected database errors.
        Parameters:
        e - The unexpected database error
